content.user_title: Automate Penetration Testing with Strategic Coordination
content.value_statement: Manual penetration testing is time-consuming and requires deep expertise across multiple domains. This skill automates the entire process using a strategic coordinator that delegates tasks to specialized agents, ensuring comprehensive testing while you focus on high-level decisions.
actual_capabilities: Automatically coordinates reconnaissance, exploitation, and privilege escalation phases
Delegates tasks to specialized exploration and general-purpose agents
Maintains persistent state tracking throughout the penetration test
Enforces completion criteria requiring both user and root flag capture
Implements ReAct methodology for systematic attack progression
Provides strategic decision-making for attack vector selection
limitations: Designed for controlled environments only (HackTheBox, VulnHub)
Requires proper authorization and ethical usage
Cannot execute attacks directly - only coordinates other agents
State management requires manual updates via bash commands

use_cases.title: Automated CTF Challenge Solving
use_cases.description: Streamline capture-the-flag competitions by automating reconnaissance and exploitation while maintaining strategic oversight.

use_cases.title: Systematic Vulnerability Assessment
use_cases.description: Ensure comprehensive testing coverage by following structured methodology that never gives up until all flags are captured.

use_cases.title: Educational Security Training
use_cases.description: Learn penetration testing methodologies through observation of automated coordinated attacks in safe environments.

prompt_templates.title: Start Basic Pentest
prompt_templates.scenario: Begin penetration test on target IP
prompt_templates.prompt: Start penetration testing on target 10.10.10.1. Use systematic reconnaissance to discover services and vulnerabilities.

prompt_templates.title: Resume Stuck Session
prompt_templates.scenario: Continue after hitting a dead end
prompt_templates.prompt: I've tried standard web exploitation but failed. Try alternative attack vectors including SMB, SSH, or service-specific exploits.

prompt_templates.title: Privilege Escalation Focus
prompt_templates.scenario: Already have user access, need root
prompt_templates.prompt: I have user access but need root privileges. Focus on privilege escalation techniques: sudo misconfigurations, SUID binaries, kernel exploits.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced AD Attack
prompt_templates.prompt: Target is an Active Directory domain controller. Use AD-specific attacks: LDAP enumeration, Kerberoasting, AS-REP roasting, delegation attacks.

best_practices: Always read current state before making strategic decisions to avoid redundant efforts
Delegate complex tasks to appropriate specialized agents rather than attempting manual execution
Trust the automated hook system to enforce completion and prevent premature stopping
anti_patterns: Never attempt to execute technical tasks yourself - always delegate to specialized agents
Don't manually update state files - let the automated hooks handle state management
Never give up or declare a target unsolvable - the system enforces continued effort

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with all Claude Code versions?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill works with all Claude Code versions and automatically activates when you provide a target IP or request penetration testing.

faq.question: What are the limitations on target systems?
faq.answer: This skill is designed for authorized testing environments only, such as HackTheBox machines or VulnHub docker-compose targets.

faq.question: How does it integrate with other security tools?
faq.answer: The coordinator delegates to exploration and general-purpose agents that can utilize standard penetration testing tools like nmap, gobuster, and metasploit.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: The skill operates locally and only targets specified systems. It maintains state in local files and doesn't transmit data externally.

faq.question: What if the agent gets stuck during testing?
faq.answer: The skill implements infinite loop logic - when stuck, it uses extended thinking and tries alternative approaches indefinitely until success.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual penetration testing?
faq.answer: While manual testing relies on human expertise, this skill provides systematic, exhaustive testing that never gives up and follows structured methodologies.
